topic.title: Cartridge-based devices
topic.p: Cartridge-based devices plug into the cartridge port of the Atari computer.
The following cartridge-based devices are emulated by Altirra:

Since these devices use the cartridge port, they can conflict with other devices that also use the same port. Typically, only one cartridge can be plugged in at a time. However, a few cartridges, notably the SpartaDOS X cartridge, have a pass-through expansion port that allows a secondary cartridge to be plugged. Altirra supports cartridge stacks, but like on real hardware, the pass-through port can interfere with the secondary cartridge's operation.

In rare cases, it is possible to set up an impossible configuration in emulation with two cartridge-based devices simultaneously active. This most often occurs when two emulated devices are activated when neither has a pass-through port. On a real computer, this would be noticed because the only way to get two such devices into the cartridge port at the same time would be with a hammer; in emulation this can result in bizarre and broken behavior.
